reviews.review_msg: Avoid, she insults her students and thinks she is better than them. Assumes they dont know anything

Taking the notoriously difficult MBB 331 course with Dr. K was challenging yet rewarding. Graded quizzes are given on paper after each lecture. You may hate this idea but will feel rewarded if you take it seriously and ask questions. The exams were very frustrating and roughly graded, but luckily, they were not the only place to get marks.

Never felt more discouraged in my life. In-class quizzes after every lecture for attendance marks based on the material she teaches that day and mandatory attendance in tutorials. Unlimited cheat sheets for all exams but it won't help you. Exams are all concepts that are not taught. Future students, STUDY THE PRACTICE EXAMS, NOT THE LECTURE SLIDES.

One of the densest classes I've ever taken. She writes entire paragraphs on a slide and then rushes through it because of the volume of info. Doesn't reward students for actively trying to learn when they reach out to her after her extra specific exams. Very black and white with what's considered a mark or not - mind your wording of everything!

Dr. K is very knowledgeable and she is very passionate in her field which makes a her a very enthusiastic teacher. The lectures are hard to understand so I have to spend more time listening to lectures and read the textbook. All 4 exams are written and all based on understanding and analyzing the gel electrophoresis. Great prof overall!

I used to be a straight-A student, but I literally cried so many times during her exams. Her exams were really tough and you either knew everything or you failed. Her lecture videos were densed and quite boring. She was definitely a tough marker. Anyways, she was still a nice person to talk with, but definitely not a great professor.
Dr. K is the best prof I have had in MBB. Tells you everything you need to know. Super helpful in office hours.

This teacher is by far the worst one I've had in my entire life. I'm a straight-A student and have never struggled to understand a course more. Her notes are all over the place and don't line up with the textbook (which you have to read because the lectures are worthless). Also, her exams are about interpreting data or thinking about crazy concepts
This professor is one of the toughest graders I have ever come across. Her tests are difficult and it doesnt help that she has an insane marking criteria. She is also quite condescending.

Irina seems nice, but when it comes to teaching, it is very hard to understand. Her slides are basically pictures, and she explains them by reading the figures description found in the textbook. The written exam questions can be difficult and they are graded very harshly. If you want to do well, you're better off just reading the textbook.

Dr. Kovalyova is very knowledgeable and passionate about the content she teaches, but she definitely makes you work for a good grade. Her lecture slides can be confusing and you generally end up needing to read the textbook alongside lectures to fully understand. She mostly puts theoretical/experimental questions on exams.
Took in the summer, went well for the effort given. She is really a great prof. Could've gotten better but hey that's summer semester.

Dr. Sneddon is an amazing professor. She is super helpful outside of class in office hours or after lecture. Her exams are fair if you study and attend office hours. She does give hints on what could be on exams and makes learning fun and easy to remember. She makes such a hard course easy to learn! Go to lecture, do the problem sets.

Dr. Sneddon is an amazin prof for MBB331. The grading if very clear and fair. The book is there but you don't actually need to read it as all of the content comes from lectures. Be sure to actually watch the lectures because Dr. Sneddon highlights the important parts. Also, attendance was needed only for tutorials. Lecures were recorded.
Best prof at SFU. 331 is a horrible course to do but this prof makes it enjoyable. super engaging !!!!

Dr. Sneddon made MBB331 a very tolerable course. Dr. Sneddon attempted to make the course as palatable as possible given the otherwise DRY course content. Throughout the semester I found Dr. Sneddon to be incredibly approachable both during office hours and by email. Overall Dr. Sneddon wants her students to do well as evident by her emailresponses

Dr. Sneddon is a wonderful, approachable prof. All of her lectures are recorded but she takes questions during breaks and right after class in-person. She offers extra Kahoots quizzes for most lectures. MBB331 is a hard course bc of dense lectures/short answer qs on exams;Ask qs on each assay!Focus on learning objectives in lectures&problem sets.

Dr Sneddon is an amazing professor. Her lectures are useful. She explains all the concepts clearly. I recommend taking 331 with her. This is a heavy course but Dr Sneddon makes it super interesting. She has clear grading criteria. If you put in effort, you will score well on her exams.

She is a nice instructor but not a good professor. She should understand everyone has different capabilities to do things and try to test accordingly. Her exams are not from lecture slides, only some unnecessary things are tested. Some questions are fully application based which were hard to do.

Dr. Sneddon truly is an amazing professor. She understands the difficulty of the course and tries to relate the material and present it in a digestible manner. Her exams are tough, but she provides lots of prep material for you to do well. The paper presentation is a huge grade booster if you put in the effort and take it seriously.

She was funny, nice person but she lacks experience teaching due to how confusing her lectures could be. Although 331 is a tough course, her exams r a bit too tough but she's a nice prof. Answers ur questions, emails, but I wish she understood that a 60% average is not great for some of us lol
